dialog: I can't take you with me.
Shit. I'm not gonna leave you with that thing on. Okay.
Get back here now! You can't do this!
How long have you been up?
Cee, you know, if you close your eyes and you lie down, that usually helps.
Um, don't think being tired gets you out of our little deal, now.
I swore to your sister I'd get you to step outside my house.
That's the furthest you've gone since you've been here. Okay?
So as far as I'm concerned, you just walked on the moon.
I can't work with this damn thing.
I told y'all about running up on me in my house.
Hey. Cee, tell her she can't take you back.
What are you doing here, Emily?
Well, it's nice to see you too, sis.
I'm gonna go see what Sydney's up to.
I asked you not to come over.
There is no news that justifies this.
Okay. I have a plan, and I just...
I need you to go along with it.
And just not be in control for one second.
I'm not trying to control you, boo.
I'm desperately trying to tell you that you don't need to cut me off anymore.
What did he do to you?
It just doesn't make any sense.
He was... he was in complete control of everything, you know?
He controlled how I looked and what I wore and what I ate.
And then it was controlling when I left the house and what I said.
If he didn't like what he assumed I was thinking...
He would... he would hit you?
He wanted to have a baby.
And I knew that if we did that, that I would never be able to get away from him, so I took birth control without him knowing it.
But, um, that can only go on for so long, so I called you.
I'm not telling you to aim low.
I'm just saying, explore more than one option, okay?
Don't limit your choices to just one school in the whole country.
But that one school is my goal.
Yeah, I told you to have goals. Plural.
I think it's important to have goals, James.
Look at you, getting out into the world.
Yo, by next year, you'll make it across the street.
Thank you both for coming in.
As the appointed attorney representing my late brother's discretionary trust, I'm required to enact his final wishes.
And he stipulated that I do this in person.
He wanted me to read a prepared statement.
"Cecilia," "although our relationship was far from perfect," "I at least thought we had built up enough trust" "that you would talk to me rather than running away from..." No. No!
Sorry, you're not allowed to do that.
Email me a copy, and we will read it.
I'm just trying to do my job.
Your job is to explain the money you mentioned on the phone.
I mentioned Cecilia, specifically, is named in Adrian's trust.
That is why we're sitting here.
For the same reason so many women in Adrian's life got close to him, his money.
If there was a chance of physically being close to him, we would not be here for any amount of money.
You are physically close to him.
He's in that urn over there.
And as per his final wishes, you're getting $5 million, estate and income tax free.
Now, the money will be staggered in installments of $100,000 each month for the next Contingent, of course, on the fine print.
You can't commit a crime, etcetera.
Normally, I would have a but I'm gonna waive my rights in that regard.
So, as soon as I have your signature and your banking information, I can start releasing the funds.
Okay, you can come in now.
Wow, that's nice. Look at that.
I know I didn't hear you just say that.
I meant to say, "thank you." Uhhuh.
Well, I knew you needed a new one, and that one just... that has to go.
That's so nice of you, Cee.
I just... I wanted to thank you for, you know, letting me stay here and for taking such good care of me, so...
And Sydney can also use ladders.
Don't think I'm helping you paint.
I wouldn't even bother to ask you.
No, not for, like, painting, obviously, but just for a lot of things.
You climb them to get things. Like...
God, I wish you had, like... oh, wait!
You could totally use the ladder...
Yeah. A ladder to climb up.
This happened to just pop up here by itself...
It has my name on it.
And it looks like your handwriting.
I just got a ladder, so I don't know what...
Let's see. A cool ladder is all.
It's a new bank account, um, with your name on it.
And I'm gonna put $10,000 in it every month for the rest of the year.
I called the account "Parsons." You're going to fashion school, kid.
That's... that's too much, Cee. Come on.
Are you sure you can do that?
Let me put it this way...
She can probably go to grad school, too.
And I don't want TV dinners, microwave nothing. Oh!
it's like, I guess... we don't have anything at all to celebrate with.
I don't know why you dancing.
You can't have none because you're not 21.
Come on. Just, like, a little bit.
He said the other day that I was mature for my age.
I'm just an innocent man trying to do right.
This is abuse. I'm a cop.
I got him, Sydney! I got him!
You know, I'm a little hungover, believe it or not.
Champagne does that to me every time.
These winter mornings are killing me.
All right, look, I'm out of here.
She's actually pretty excited, thanks to you. She, uh...
She might need a little help staying focused.
No, no, no. Don't use water.
You think we can salvage it?
There were footprints. I saw it!
Yes, I saw... on the sheets!
Syd, put that stupid thing away.
You're the one who bought it for me!
Adrian will haunt you if you let him.
Now, you should try and get some sleep.
You have an important job interview tomorrow, and I don't want the memory of this...
This person to ruin it. Okay?
After Cal poly, I worked in Paris for 6 months.
That was the best time of my life for sure.
Except for this next phase, of course.
So, any reason you worked in Paris in particular?
Is that where all the beautiful women in the world have to go as a rule?
Well, I speak a little French, and I've always wanted to live there.
So after I graduated, I went out there on a totally student budget.
I slept in a broom closet, literally.
I started this firm in a supply closet, literally.
We both know the value of closet space. Yeah.
Let me see some of your work.
I don't, uh... l know that I...
I know I put them in here, so I apologize.
I don't know what happened. Uh...
Uh, you can send it to us, whenever you get a chance.
So, uh, let me tell you about us.
At ruler, we approach architecture on a human level.
Would you like some water, or...
Okay, so, uh, you probably shouldn't drive or operate any heavy machinery for the next few days.
But other than that, you seem fine.
Either myself or my admitting will follow up with you with the results of the blood test. Okay?
Can you just leave a number with the nurse?
You guys can go home. Okay.
Hi. Uh, this is Doctor Lee at St. Vincent's.
So, we got the results of your blood test back, and it looks like the Diazepam was the most likely cause of you fainting.
Well, your blood work showed a very high amount of it.
That would definitely explain what happened to you.
There's something else I wanted to talk to you about, but I'm not sure if we should do it over the phone, so, um...
Tell him to stop what he's doing.
Do you know what she's babbling about?
Nah, she hasn't explained to me why we're here yet but.
Being her very good friend, I know it's a good reason.
So I'm gonna need you to sit up and listen.
One night, I was sitting, and I was thinking about how to leave Adrian.
I was planning the whole thing in my mind.
And he was staring at me.
And without me saying a single word...
He said that I could never leave him.
That wherever I went, he would find me.
That he would walk right up to me and I wouldn't be able to see him.
But that he would leave me a sign so that I'd know he was there.
The night I left him, I drugged him with that.
I lost the bottle that night.
And somehow, it found its way back to me.
So, what exactly are you saying?
You lost the bottle, you found the bottle.
I have a pile of ashes in a box that would disagree with you, Cecilia.
I don't know how he's done it.
He has figured out a way to be invisible.
He is a world leader in the field of optics.
I know that he could do this.
Something tells me you know exactly what I'm talking about.
I agree with you, Adrian was brilliant.
But it wasn't because of anything he invented.
It was how he got in people's heads.
That was his true genius, knowing people's weaknesses.
He came up with the perfect way to torture you, even in death.
Only thing more brilliant than inventing something that makes you invisible is not inventing it, but making you think he did.
My brother controlled me long before he met you, Cecilia.
You and I, we got that in common.
I was relieved when I heard that he was dead.
Don't let him win by bringing him back to life.
Emily, I need to talk to you.
Well, at least now we have clarity.
Now I know what you really think of me.
Thanks so much for carving out the time to let me know how "suffocating" I am to you.
Not that I should have to say this, but I never expected any of that money.
Emily, I don't... I don't know what you're talking about.
The email. The email you sent me this morning.
What email? If that's how you feel about me, don't ask me to bail you out of your personal life anymore.
If you're too stupid to know who the good guys are and too weak to get away from the bad ones, don't sob to me for charity.
I didn't send you the fucking email.
Someone is doing this to me.
He's... he's doing this to me.
Adrian sent me the email. Okay.
You... you know what I think we need?
I think we could kick dad out and have a little girls' night.
Why would you just... stop! Dad!
James, I did not do that.
Sydney, I would never hit you.
I would never do that, James. It was him.
He's here, I swear to you.
Sydney, I'm sorry. I would never...
Cee, right now, my priority is getting my baby somewhere safe.
This is what he used to do when we were together.
He wants you to think that I did it.
He tries to isolate me and he tries to get me alone...
If I were you, I would go to your sister's place.
You don't need to be here right now.
Where are you? Come on out.
You could have any woman you wanted.
That's what money and power buy you.
I'm just a suburban girl who Stumbled into your life one night at a party.
Can't you just forget I ever existed?
There's nothing left for you to take.
Please leave a message, and I'll get back to you when I can.
Lock the doors. Lock the doors!
That's a long way from here.
I... I just need to get something.
Do you mind waiting for me?
I might be 2 minutes, I might be 20.
But you can bring me back to the city after.
Please, meet me tonight, if you can, in a public place.
And if you can't, I understand, but you have to tell me because I have to call someone else, because I don't think I have much time left.
My name is Taylor, and I will be taking care of you this evening.
Do you know how this place works?
I'm assuming you order food, then you eat it. Hmm.
Pretty much. We just do things a little bit differently.
Okay. Can I get you started with some water?
You're like a cop, Emily, and you have this bruteforce strength that is so, so comforting when I'm in trouble and it is really intimidating when I'm not.
I mean, James actually is a 6foot cop, and he's, I think, really intimidated by you.
I need that strength in my life right now.
And I need you to believe what I'm about to tell you.
All right, uh, do you guys need more time with the drink menu?
I went to his house today.
You went to Adrian's house? Yes.
I found something that can prove what I'm experiencing.
That can prove that Adrian is stalking me.
It's some kind of suit that Adrian has built.
And it has cameras, and it somehow...
He killed her! He killed her!
No! No he killed her! He did it!
You have to listen to me!
He's right here, he's right here!
You have to listen to me!
Can you confirm the person in this video is you?
And can you confirm you recently fainted during a job interview due to a high amount of Diazepam in your system?
You also sent your sister an email a few days ago saying you wished she was dead, didn't you?
I have something that'll prove he's alive.
I can't tell you right now.
You're saying that the person who killed your sister is in the room right now, but we can't see him.
Tell me you don't think I did this.
I may as well have done it, though.
I brought Adrian into her life.
I shouldn't have walked out on you and left you alone.
Is this bed giving you any problems, Cecilia?
Is there anything in the room that is distressing to you?
I wanted to talk to you about something.
We checked the blood test that you had done at the hospital last week.
Do you remember taking those blood tests?
Well, did you know that you were pregnant?
Didn't the doctor who took the test tell you?
The test shows us that it was pretty recent.
We can't be sure of exactly when, but it must've been some time in the last month.
Sweetie, is there anyone we can call?
It's upsetting to see you in this condition.
Even though things ended badly for you and Adrian, I still look at you as family.
I'm the lawyer for your source of income.
The money from his trust was payable to you conditional upon you being subject to criminal charges of any kind, or being ruled to be mentally incompetent.
Now, in light of your current situation, it's my duty to inform you that any further payments are to be halted.
I know that you set up a bank account for a friend of yours to go to college.
So, I take no pleasure in relaying that.
I used to feel sorry for you.
The blood relative of a narcissist sociopath.
But now, I can see you for what you really are.
You're just the jellyfish version of him.
You can try to litigate it.
But that's going to be an expensive option.
If you sign this document and forfeit your share of the trust, it'll be a lot cleaner.
Or there's one option where this all goes away.
Agree to have the baby and go back to him.
You really think he didn't know you were secretly using birth control?
You should've known he'd find out.
You knew him as well as I did.
He replaced them with something else.
You only thought you were taking birth control pills.
He was always going to find you, no matter what he had to do.
He needs you because you don't need him.
No one's ever left him before.
But he's punished you enough now.
Now that he knows you're the mother of his child.
It's time to stop playing games.
A new life with him can be given to you with one phone call.
A life just like your old one with Adrian.
Cecilia, you don't really have a choice right now.
I don't expect you to make a decision right now.
I can come back in 3 days.
Be good to yourself until then.
Grab the umbrella, grab your rain jacket, grab your rain boots, you're gonna need it.
You'll need them for a couple of days.
This pattern we're in stays put.
We've got this atmospheric river pointed right here al central California.
And that means cloudy and rainy as we get through the rest of the week.
This is a lot of moisture coming in.
It's going to mean heavy rainfall and flashflooding concerns right as we get through the end of the week.
It's not until the weekend that we get our next chance of seeing some dry conditions.
In fact, the next glimpse of sunshine even doesn't come until Sunday afternoon, when temperatures hit the mid60s.
But until then, it's gonna be cool, it's gonna be damp...
Hey! Okay. Get back! Get back!
You think you're learning how to beat me, so I'm gonna truly teach you something.
If you fight me, I won't ever hurt you.
I'll find someone you love and hurt them instead.
Now you've only got yourself to blame for that innocent young girl's death.
Hold it! Show me your hands!
She's heading towards the main exit!
He's fine. He's fine, I promise.
You have to listen to me.
I'm at work. She's at the house.
You need to go to her right now, James.
'Cause I'm afraid Adrian is gonna do something to her.
Our tactical team found Adrian this morning, tied up in his basement.
Looks like he was a victim of his brother just like you were.
He is not the victim here.
He was tied up in his basement.
If he faked his own death, he could fake his own kidnapping.
We have Tom's body laying in my living room, wearing some sort of suit that you shot to pieces.
If it did work, it doesn't now.
But we have a whole bunch of corroborative witnesses from the psychiatric hospital when it comes to seeing something strange.
Look, this is your bestcase scenario for getting your freedom back, okay?
I know Tom's body is in your living room. Yeah.
Adrian did everything before that though.
He set his own brother up.
I know how this works, Cee.
He makes me feel like I'm the crazy one.
This is... this is what he does.
I need you to keep that to yourself and let me do my job.
Yeah, but as long as Adrian's around, you can't help me.
So, I... I wanted to get us some simple takeout, but of course I started obsessing over what you'd be in the mood for.
Hence, we have the ocd buffet of Sushi, steak, and pasta.
Or you might not be hungry at all.
Which is so logical that it suddenly makes this feast look moronic.
You know, you're the only person in the world who gets to see my hand shake.
I know I didn't treat you the way you should have been treated when we were together.
I would burn everything I own just to prove that to you.
If you want to be a part of this child's life, it has to start with honesty.
Which means I need you to admit everything that you did.
That it was you, not your brother.
And I thought he loved me, too.
I know it didn't seem like it to the outside world, but Tom controlled me.
I need to know that I'm not crazy.
And we can't start this with a lie.
But I'm not starting with a lie.
Why can't you just tell me the truth?
I need you to do this for me.
More than that, do it for you, Adrian.
I'm giving you exactly what you're asking for, Cecilia.
I am telling you the truth.
I know that you feel like you're going insane sometimes.
But I'm the only one who can help you.
Because I know you better than anyone else in the world.
I should go clean myself up.
No, no! What did you do?
Please, you have to help me, please.
I'm with somebody, and I think he's...
There's security camera video of it.
You never did want to get him admitting anything on tape, did you?
I just didn't know he was that unstable.
What'd it sound like to you?
It sounded a lot like he killed himself.
